entry.title: The Social Security (Disclosure of State Pension Information) Regulations 2000
entry.summary: The regulations contained in this instrument are made before the end of the period of 6 months beginning with the coming into force of section 42 of the Child Support, Pensions and Social Security Act 2000 on 1st December 2000. Proposals to make these Regulations are therefore exempt by section 173(5)(a) of the Social Security Administration Act 1992 from reference to the Social Security Advisory Committee and have not been so referred.

entry.title: The Social Security (Contributions) (Japan) Order (Northern Ireland) 2000
entry.summary: This Order makes provision for the modification of the Social Security Contributions and Benefits (Northern Ireland) Act 1992 and the Social Security Administration (Northern Ireland) Act 1992 so as to give effect in Northern Ireland to the Agreement on Social Security between the Government of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland and the Government of Japan. The provisions relate to liability for social security insurance contributions arising in respect of employment and self-employment.

entry.title: The War Pensions Committees Regulations 2000
entry.summary: These Regulations make changes to the constitution and functions of war pensions committees. Such committees were established by regulations pursuant to section 25 of the Social Security Act 1989. Existing committees are abolished and new ones set up. Except in the case of Northern Ireland (for which there continues to be one committee), the new committees generally cover larger areas, and they are fewer in number. There is one committee for Wales (regulation 4), one for Northern Ireland (regulation 5) and two for Scotland (regulation 6). Nine regional committees are set up for England (regulation 3 and Schedule 1).

entry.title: The Child Support (Voluntary Payments) Regulations 2000
entry.summary: These Regulations are made pursuant to section 28J of the Child Support Act 1991 (c. 48) (“the Act”) as inserted by the Child Support, Pensions and Social Security Act 2000 (c. 19) (“the 2000 Act”). Section 28J of the Act provides for the Secretary of State to offset against child support maintenance arrears, or to adjust a maintenance calculation to take account of, voluntary payments.

entry.title: The Fire Services (Amendment) (1998 Order) (Commencement) Order (Northern Ireland) 2000
entry.summary: This Order brings into operation on 30th September 2001, Articles 5 and 6 of the Fire Services (Amendment) (Northern Ireland) Order 1998 (“the 1998 Order”). The 1998 Order amends the Fire Services (Northern Ireland) Order 1984 so as to make new provision with respect to members of the Fire Authority for Northern Ireland nominated by certain councils and associations.

entry.title: The Social Security (Child Maintenance Premium and Miscellaneous Amendments) Regulations 2000
entry.summary: These Regulations come into force at different times for different cases according to the dates on which section 23 of the Child Support, Pensions and Social Security Act 2000 (c. 19) which is relevant to these Regulations, is commenced for different types of cases.

entry.title: The Child Support (Temporary Compensation Payment Scheme) Regulations 2000
entry.summary: These Regulations provide for a temporary compensation scheme made under section 27 of the Child Support, Pensions and Social Security Act 2000 (“the Act”) in certain cases where there has been a delay in the making of a maintenance assessment under the Child Support Act 1991 leading to arrears of child support maintenance.

entry.title: The Terrorism Act 2000 (Video recording of interviews)Order 2000
entry.summary: This Order requires interviews of persons detained under Schedule 7 (Port and Border Controls) or section 41 (arrest without warrant of a person reasonably suspected of being a terrorist) of the Terrorism Act 2000 which are conducted by a police constable at a police station in Northern Ireland to be video recorded, and that the video recording should be with sound. “Police station” includes any place which the Secretary of State has designated under paragraph 1(1) of Schedule 8 to the Terrorism Act 2000 as a place where a person may be detained under section 41 of that Act. The Order also requires the interviews and video recording to be conducted in accordance with a code of practice made for the purpose by the Secretary of State under paragraphs 3(4)(a) and 4(4) of Schedule 8 to the Terrorism Act 2000.

entry.title: The Financial Assistance for Environmental Purposes (Scotland) Order 2000
The Professions Supplementary to Medicine (Registration) (Amendment) Rules Order of Council 2000
entry.summary: The Rules approved by this Order increase, by amounts ranging from approximately 29 per cent to approximately 42 per cent, with effect from 1st December 2000, the registration, retention and restoration fees payable to the Boards established under the Professions Supplementary to Medicine Act 1960. The fees were last fixed in 1992.

entry.title: The Child Support, Pensions and Social Security Act 2000 (Commencement No. 4) Order 2000
entry.summary: This Order brings into force further provisions of the Child Support, Pensions and Social Security Act 2000, as follows:

entry.title: The Child Support, Pensions and Social Security (2000 Act) (Commencement No. 2) Order (Northern Ireland) 2000
entry.summary: This Order provides for the coming into operation of provisions of the Child Support, Pensions and Social Security Act (Northern Ireland) 2000 as follows—

entry.title: The Plastic Materials and Articles in Contact with Food (Amendment) (Scotland) Regulations 2000
entry.summary: These Regulations, which extend to Scotland only, amend the Plastic Materials and Articles in Contact with Food Regulations 1998 (“the 1998 Regulations”). These Regulations implement Commission Directive 1999/91/EC amending Directive 90/128/EEC relating to plastic materials and articles intended to come into contact with foodstuffs.

entry.title: Ionising Radiations Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2000
entry.summary: These Regulations supersede and consolidate the Ionising Radiations Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1985 (S.R. 1985 No. 273) and the Ionising Radiations (Outside Workers) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1993 (S.R. 1993 No. 469).

entry.title: The Insurance Brokers Registration Council (Registration and Enrolment) (Amendment) Rules Approval Order 2000
entry.summary: This Order approves Rules made by the Insurance Brokers Registration Council in exercise of its powers under section 8(2) of the Insurance Brokers (Registration) Act 1977.

entry.title: The Environment Act 1995 (Commencement No. 19) (Scotland) Order 2000
The Controlled Foreign Companies (Designer Rate Tax Provisions) Regulations 2000
entry.summary: This version of the The Controlled Foreign Companies (Designer Rate Tax Provisions) Regulations 2000 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The Food Protection (Emergency Prohibitions) (Amnesic Shellfish Poisoning) (West Coast) (No. 2) (Scotland) Partial Revocation (No. 5) Order 2000
